title: I do not understand the goal of these leona changes.
body:
Currently on PBE:

    Sunlight (Passive) damage lowered to [20 + 5 per level] from [20 + 15 per 2 levels]
    Shield of Daybreak (Q):
        Cooldown lowered to 9/8/7/6/5 from 11/10/9/8/7
        Damage lowered to 30/55/80/105 from 40/70/100/130/160
    Eclipse (W):
        Damage now 60/100/140/180/220 from 60/110/160/210/260
    Zenith Blade (E) root duration increased to .5 from .25
    Solar Flare (R) 
        Damage lowered to 100/175/250 from 150/250/350
        New Effect: Leona's sword remains charged with Incandescence, causing her next 3/4/5 basic attacks to gain 100 range and deal 30/50/70 (+ 15% AP) bonus magic damage on hit. 
            Incandescence also now applies Leona's passive, it did not in earlier iterations.

Why exactly are you significantly hitting her damage and backloading some of it onto her new ultimate effect? Leona's job is one of a peel tank without any disengage. Once she goes in, shes stuck in the fight. Meaning she is more likely to die than many other champions. You aren't providing her with anything more than a shorter cooldown on a single target stun and a minimal increase in zenith blade root duration. What is the goal here? From what I see, she does significantly less damage on every basic ability, including her passive, to the benefit of slightly more frequent use of a stun. Is that a fair tradeoff, or are you intentionally nerfing Leona?

I ask these questions because I used to play Leona religiously until I discovered that every other tank support does her job better than she does.
**
EDIT: Wow, I was not expecting this much feedback, thanks! In response to some of the comments, I want to make it clear that Leona losing damage is not my real concern, it is what she is getting in return. Is the reduced stun cooldown worth the amount of damage she is losing? Zenith blade cooldown is unchanged as well.**

replies.body:
We're looking to give Leona more stuff to do in a teamfight. At present she blows her combo quickly and then can't contribute much meaningfully until her CDs are back up. Given she's putting herself in the middle of the fight by necessity we'd like her to have things she can do there that matter, hence the auto attack reward on the ult and the CD decrease on the Q.

It's also worth calling out that the Q change is a pretty substantial buff. At max rank with 40% CDR it's a difference of a 4.2s CD versus a 3s CD. The stun's got a duration of 1s, so that means the time a target's unstunned drops from 3.2s to 2s. 

Finally Leona's also looking very strong in the current patch (6.13). There'll be a mixture of things contributing to that, one of them though's the changes to XP that affects supports in particular. Leona's pretty level dependent to contribute, much more so than most other supports, so it looks like she may have benefited more  than most. Fairly confident as a result that even if we're wrong about the power (as opposed to play pattern) impact of these changes that she won't end up too weak in the next patch.

That got removed, didn't generate sufficiently engaging gameplay for the amount of power it offered.

I very highly question how removing so much early power on a snowball reliant melee champion isn't going to completely screw her over. The powerspike at lvl 6 will be nice but that's little solace for a champ so reliant on lvl 2 and lvl 3 all ins.

This does concern me a bit too. Leona was incredibly reliant on the early game success. Level 3 engages were as common as Lucian's level 2 power spike. Without as much early game damage, or without sufficient tradeoffs granted at later stages of the game, I wonder how well she will fare.

My question is about the new passive on ult: Its cool that it lasts for 5 seconds and all, but its kind of a joke I think that it applies her passive. I mean, you only get 5 seconds, and in big fights, you will probably be focused on a single target. Most Leona plays I see there is very little weaving her spells to get that passive damage proc because of how quickly her passive gets applied by her.

Only giving her 5 seconds to apply up to 5 attacks at max rank doesn't encourage her to hit (let ally proc) hit (let ally proc). in fact, at level 6 when you first get it, its more likely you are going to ult, E to target, AA-Q-AA to get all 3 procs of your extra damage off. Her passive is TECHNICALLY applied 6 times (would be 7 but one of your buffed autos was also your shield bash) if your adc follows up really well, you MIGHT get 3 procs of the passive. MAYBE. Once after the ult, once after she dives in and AA-Q-AA, and once after her W explodes.

Timer to apply stacks resets each time you land an auto attack. That means it's not 5 seconds to land 5 attacks, but 5 seconds since your last attack to land the next one. Should make it very feasible to land all the empowered auto attacks if you're in going combat.

The ideas mentioned before were the basic versions, heres a more advanced one focused on the passiv:
passiv stacks: 1 stack= 100% dmg, 2stacks = 150% dmg, 3 stacks = 200% dmg and an effect.
____

**Explaination:**
giving a bonus to 2 stacks rounds the feeling so 2 stacks are not complettly useless. Futhermore it gives leona something better when she uses her E-Q engage combo at early levels.
The 50% dmg increase is there to give her some meaningful dmg if she lands it, but not to crazy dmg. We are talking about a dmg increase of 15 - 55 dmg from level 2 to 18. and with 3 stacks 30 - 110. 
If those numbers seem to high i would suggest 25%-50% dmg increase on 2 and 3 stacks, or no dmg increase on the 3 stack only the effect.
____ 

**Effects**
The possible Effects if a 3 times stacked passiv is proced.
First the common situations are:
R-E-Q
rAA-Q-rAA
rAA-W-rAA 

The max amount of 3 stacked passiv proc in a full teamfight is 2 times, in a 2v2 it can be 3 times if coordinated.
**Thematicly fitting Effects:**

- blinded
- nearsighted
- stunned
- burn(like brand passiv)
- slowed

Those effects only cc/dmg an enemy, but giving leona more dmg/cc is tricky and i would go against that.  
So a change to a debuff/buff is **highly** advised.

- flat movement speed reduced/ stealed/ given to a)only leona b)the one that proced it(never leona)
- amplified magic dmg taken by all sources (maybe only leona but this seems not so good)
- reducing Mr and/or Ar (sunlight meltation)
- give leona bonuses to W or flat Mr/Ar (W is likely not exploded)
- amplify cc duration by 10-25%(her main cc comb is done so cc from team is amplified in 90% of all cases and engage is likely on the tank)
- truesight(shiny enemy :D)

Those are all only minor debuffs, no complete changes its not a full rework.
But the bigger ones might overload her kit, flat mr/ar/ms should be good enough.
Thanks again for reading this :D

Is this accurate to what we're discussing:  "New Effect: Leona's sword remains charged with Incandescence, causing her next 3/4/5 basic attacks to gain 100 range and deal 30/50/70 (+ 15% AP) bonus magic damage on hit. 
Incandescence also now applies Leona's passive, it did not in earlier iterations."

In Shahamut's example of a typical lvl 6 engage, Leona  will often get all 3 basic attacks in before her ally can even proc 1 sunlight passive.  Won't this setup mean that she is often wasting several of those passive marks?  Or will subsequent AA's not consume the incandescence unless the sunlight has been proc'd?

>  Or will subsequent AA's not consume the incandescence unless the sunlight has been proc'd?

This would not be a good idea, because she would lose her extra damage if she didnt have an ally who could/did follow up.

Good point, I hadn't thought of the bonus Incandescence damage.  I was only thinking about having to weave her spells as you described.  Perhaps it just accentuates her strengths/weaknesses (necessity of having a teammate go all-in with you).  Weaving her passive between allies' damage would certainly raise her skillcap.  Unfortunately, this is often very reliant on a sometimes random teammate.

Cool! That is helpful, but I am still concerned about how many passive procs actually happen in a typical 2v2 since Leona is all in. She doesn't exactly weave her spells, and expecting a champ like that to weave her passive with an ally seems a bit unrealistic.

Was there any particular reason you moved the Incandescence from her Eclipse to her Solar Flare?
In large part it was simply that the amount of power we'd have to cut elsewhere was much higher if it was an effect that could occur all the time on the W.

Speaking of cut power, why is Leona's W still weaker at higher ranks even after the Incandescence effect was moved? It was never really a strong damage source before, and with her Sunlight damage lower (in exchange for her having more opportunities to apply it), it doesn't make sense to me why Eclipse still has to lose 40 damage at rank 5.

"We're looking to give Leona more stuff to do in a teamfight."
hmm...
"New Effect: Leona's sword remains charged with Incandescence, causing her next 3/4/5 basic attacks to gain 100 range and deal 30/50/70 (+ 15% AP) bonus magic damage on hit.
Incandescence also now applies Leona's passive, it did not in earlier iterations."

So before this change Leona could... deliver auto attacks in a teamfight.
And after this change Leona can... deliver auto attacks in a teamfight.
Leona doesn't actually gain anything "more" to do, she just gets some of her power shifted from her combo to her auto attacks.

I'm not really opposed to the change any more than I am for the change, but it seems that it would be more accurately described as delaying Leona's damage to the target.  Similar to the idea of how RIOT wants to delay the damage that assassins do so that they don't immediately kill their targets but instead offer their targets a window of potential action (still curious to see how that goes).

Lowered damage on a tank support at the exchange of more stuns and longer roots is basically the best change one could hope for.

She lost damage that she didn't care about as much as CCing people and now gets better at it. And in the case where she does a good job bot and feeds her carry (and herself), her overall dps got slightly higher in the case where she constantly attacks a target as she does her job.

I dunno why peeps are crying, this mini-rework is clearly a buff in my opinion. She'll be a better pick than Alistar vs single, potentially duo threat comps, while Alistar will still be the go-to pick when you need someone with stronger CC but longer CDs.

It is not so much her damage that bothers me as much as her ability to stay on a target. If you are going to initiate a fight, you are going to take the brunt of up-front damage. They should at least make Eclipse scale better or something. What good is it to be a cc-bot if you can't survive the first 4 seconds of a team fight?

I don't want her to have high damage values, but I want her to be good for something more than getting in to a fight, getting blasted, and dying.
